unabashed_medicine_cat1: Yeah, I gave r_w nasty herbs on purpose.

assertive_mentor5: I noticed you treating r_c the other day, and it really wasn't bad! You've come a long way. But, one thing I did notice was that you were a little too ... nice when delivering {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} diagnosis?
Not that you shouldn't be kind when trying to help your Clanmates. That's not what I mean. But you shouldn't be too afraid to say what you really mean, either.
We're medicine cats. It's our job to be honest with our Clanmates when something is wrong! Not protect their feelings.
The medicine den is a scary place, and you want to help cats feel safer. But isn't it better for a Clanmate to know what they're in for, rather than believe a nicer lie?
Hm ... maybe I should be the one in charge of delivering the bad news from now on.
assertive_mentor6: You've been doing a fine job, y_c! Keep this up and you'll be getting your medicine cat name soon.

But, ah, when you do, I hope you don't just keep following the exact methods and techniques I've taught you here. Take risks! Experiment! Try new things! That's what being a good medicine cat's all about.

If my mentor saw the methods I was using to treat some of these cats, they'd have me exiled, if not skinned alive ... but I don't believe in that type of thinking. There's not just one way of doing things.
You're your own medicine cat! You should do things the way you think is best for the Clan. Not just because I told you it was the 'right' way.
assertive_mentor3: Something I've noticed about you, y_c, is that you think too much.

That's not exactly a bad thing, plenty of apprentices are hesitant, but when one of your Clanmates needs your help, there's no time for thinking. You just have to see the problem in front of you, and go for it!
Then again, I can't even remember how many times I've been chewed out by the deputy for acting too rashly ...
I guess it's all about balance. You can't doubt yourself too much, but you can't be blinded by confidence, either.
It's a tough thing to master, but I know you can do it!

assertive_elder_12: Eeek! The half-moon meeting is coming up! Aren't you excited?

cool_medcat_AJ1~1: Hey, y_c. I just got a message from StarClan. They told me that you need to pass me that scrap of moss over there.

Ah, well, that's easy ... The medicine den is full of adventure!

introspective_Med_1: Yes, y_c? Do you need something?

introspective_Med_2: ... Hey, uh, y_c? Are you busy?
Oh, yes, I'm fine. I just wanted to come check up on you.
Yeah, I know you're physically fine, but you haven't come into the medicine den for a bit, so I haven't been able to ask you how you've been.
If you need someone to talk to, I'm here. I think I may have told you this once, but, I may not be the best talker, but I'm infinitely capable of listening to you.

[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/gesture/gestures} you away with {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tail, hiding {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} face in mild embarrassment.]
introspective_Med_4: ... Oh! y_c? How long have you been there? I'm sorry, I wasn't ignoring you.
I was looking up at the night sky. Silverpelt is in full display to us; StarClan must be in a pleasant mood today.
... Yeah, I come out of the den to stare at the sky a lot. I wonder if StarClan knows I'm looking up at them, do they appreciate it? That they're always on my mind?

If I show them enough appreciation, will they send me more messages, so I can continue to look after everyone properly? So I can remove the burden off my mind of some... disaster happening that I can't prevent?

introspective_Med_5: [You're wandering on a solo hunting patrol when the soft scent of herbs flutters into your nose. Is that t_c?]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} gently biting the flowers off of some golden plant, and don't seem to have noticed you.]
... Huh? Oh, y_c. I didn't think I'd see you here today. Are you on a hunting patrol?

Imagine how bad wounds can get without marigold to help. You could lose a leg by infection at worst.
So getting it is far more essential than my desire to watch it. Plus I'm not grabbing all of it, there will be enough for it to grow back.
... Anyways, you've got a hunt to get back to, and I need to get these back to the herb store, in case they're needed. You have a wonderful rest of your day, may StarClan light your path, y_c.

assertive_queen: Heya, y_c! How are the little ones today?

assertivemedcat_queensapp3_2: How goes it, y_c? Ready for another herb lesson?

assertivemedcat_queensapp4: How goes it, y_c? Ready for another herb lesson?

silly_med_sleep: Awh, why am I so tired all the time?

silly_med_ideas: I love my role as a medicine cat.
Seriously. I'm not the kind of cat to exercise my physical muscles. I much prefer to exercise my mental ones.
I get to come up with and practice new ideas almost every day. There's a level of innovation with this job that I just adore compared to the monotonous life of a warrior.
Sure, I could be a mediator or a permanent queen, but even if I still had the option, even if I were still an apprentice, I'd still choose the medicine den life any day.

...Even though it means I have to explain to r_c that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} have moons of experience, and the herbs {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} tried to feed someone are permanent sleep herbs, not temporary sleep herbs.

silly_med_spectate: y_c, I'm lonely today. Wanna sit in the medicine den with me?
[You tell t_c that you'd love to, but you have something to do today.]

[While there, t_c tells you all {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/know/knows} about traveling herbs. This counts as productivity, right?]

neurotic_medcat_SQ9: [t_c gazes around the medicine den, admiring the stockpiled herbs. When {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/see/sees} you, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/smile/smiles} self-consciously.]

When I was a loner, I collected some herbs, but never this many. I never stayed in one place for long, you know? And the one time I started a big collection, a gang of rogues took over my spot and stole them...
c_nClan just feels so much safer than being on my own. I love it a lot.
neurotic_medcat_SQ10: I was helping r_m treat r_i's injury, but I think I might've overstepped. r_m was leading, you know?
But r_i asked for advice on a few things, and I answered, and r_m gave a different answer, and I felt bad.
I didn't mean to undermine {PRONOUN/r_m/poss} authority, or anything like that! I just wanted to be helpful.
*Sigh* Anyways, I'm going to wait outside the den for a bit, and then I guess I'll... go and talk to {PRONOUN/r_m/object} and clear things up.
neurotic_medcat_SQ11: There's a cold draft blowing into the medicine den. Could you help me move some of the nests out of the way?
I usually wouldn't bother you, but I was having trouble doing it myself. And when cats are already sick or injured, it's especially important they aren't too cold!
It would be terrible if moving into the medicine den made them get worse.
neurotic_medcat_SQ12: Whenever I gather herbs, I want to collect more than I think we'll need, in case there's an outbreak or an attack or anything else unexpected.
But then I'm worried I'll overharvest, and accidentally destroy our herb patches.
...That's why I'm glad you're here. I like having a second opinion when we go collecting.
neurotic_about_r_s_SQ1: It's so cold today. I'm really worried it's going to make r_s's condition a lot worse.
I'm going to stay awake tonight and keep an eye on {PRONOUN/r_s/object}, okay? And I don't want to interrupt your sleep, but could I wake you up if I need help?
neurotic_about_r_s_SQ2: Have you checked on r_s recently? I think {PRONOUN/r_s/subject}{VERB/r_s/'re/'s} looking all right, but I'd like your opinion.
I'd hate to miss any sign that {PRONOUN/r_s/subject}{VERB/r_s/'re/'s} getting worse!
neurotic_about_r_s_SQ3: [When you bring some herbs over to t_c, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/lift/lifts} {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} head and {VERB/t_c/blink/blinks} blearily. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/lean/leans} away when {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/realize/realizes} what you're carrying.]
Wait, y_c, don't waste those on me. Give them to plove_r_s first, please. I don't want to be the reason {PRONOUN/plove_r_s/subject} {VERB/plove_r_s/don't/doesn't} get better.
[You assure t_c that you have enough herbs for both {PRONOUN/t_c/object} and plove_r_s, and that {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/deserve/deserves} treatment as much as any cat.]
[t_c relents, but keeps {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} eyes on plove_r_s's sleeping form.]
neurotic_sc_to_sc_SQ1: It makes me nervous to watch r_m sometimes. {PRONOUN/r_m/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_m/'re/'s} capable, but I'm still worried {PRONOUN/r_m/subject}{VERB/r_m/'re/'s} going to make a mistake while treating someone, and I'll be powerless to stop {PRONOUN/r_m/object}...
But... but somehow, I can't stop watching! When I'm not keeping an eye on {PRONOUN/r_m/object}, I'm even more stressed.
neurotic_sc_to_sc_SQ2: [t_c is perched on a starry cliffside, gazing down at the medicine den. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/shift/shifts} back and forth worriedly.]
r_s seems to be getting worse, and I don't know if r_m has noticed. If I were closer, I'd be able to do something... I wish I could do something.
neurotic_sc_to_sc_SQ3: There's some more of the herbs r_m is using for r_s at the far back of the shelf.
I hope {PRONOUN/r_m/subject} {VERB/r_m/notice/notices}... I hope {PRONOUN/r_m/subject} {VERB/r_m/don't/doesn't} think {PRONOUN/r_m/subject}{VERB/r_m/'ve/'s} run out.
neurotic_youforgiven_SQ2: [You have a minor cut, so you find t_c to get it treated. As soon as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/see/sees} you, t_c runs over, blocking you from going any deeper into the medicine den.]
Hi, y_c! What can I help with? A cut? Okay, wait right there...
[t_c begins sorting through {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} supplies, but keeps looking back to make sure you haven't moved from the entrance.]
[It seems {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} still {VERB/t_c/don't/doesn't} trust you anywhere near {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} herb stores...]
med_to_newborn_H1: [t_c noses at your side, checking for any noticeable discomfort, as medicine cats do.]
[When {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/don't/doesn't} find anything particularly concerning, t_c licks the top of your head to provide some comfort.]
TinyTeddy_stable_theymedicine_youapp_01: Oh for the love- WHAT IN STARCLAN'S NAME DID YOU GET INTO THIS TIME?!
Good, good... Been very good. You?
['So anyways, I found funky looking rock, you wanna see?']
YES PLEASE! I was wondering when you'd find something interesting to share with me!
TinyTeddy_stable_theymedicine_youapp_02: Watch yourself out there, y_c. I don't want to see you in the medicine den.
TinyTeddy_stable_theymedicine_youapp_03: y_c, thank you for stopping by, I have a favour to ask, could you please give these to m_n? They were asking about them earlier but I didn't have a chance to catch up.
Thank you, y_c. m_n has trained you well.
TinyTeddy_stable_theymedicine_mentor_you: r_m commented on how well you organised the herb collection earlier, I know you're taking a break but I've been out all day and I wanted to see it for myself, please follow me.

[You follow your mentor into the medicine cat den, you hold your breath as {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} inspect every plant with unbreakable focus. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} click {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tongue and turn back to you, nodding in approval.]
Ha, it looks like r_m was right, this is perfect! Well done, y_c, very proud of your work today.
y_c could you please pass me the cobwebs?

Thank you! I'm heading off, o_cClan asked for some assistance and I'll be out for a while. I trust that you can look after the medicine den. If you're unsure about anything, ask r_m for help and don't be afraid to ask t_m either.
I made sure to teach them some tricks that will be very useful- Actually, make sure to tell them that I'm gone, they're currently out with l_n and d_n at the moment... I'm sorry, I need to go, y_c.
TinyTeddy_stable_theymedicine_youadult_0: Here, have some of this, it will help. Please don't worry, y_c, you're in good paws. You're going to get better. I won't let anything happen to you, I promise.
StarClan needs to watch our clanmates better, this should have never happened... Not to a cat like you...
Would you like anything to eat?
Okay, I can arrange that, you stay here. I'll be back in a moment.
Ah, ah, ah, ah! Sit back down, y_c! StarClan, don't you go pushing yourself. If you need something, you tell me, it's my job- NO!
No, you are not bothering me by telling me what you need, why would you think that? So what is it that you're after?
Some water? Pft, that can easily be arranged, I'll go get that for you now- AND DON'T YOU MOVE FROM THAT SPOT!

[t_c bolts out of the den, you smirk to yourself as you lay back down, you decide to stretch out your paw to where it just rests outside of your nest. t_c shuffles back inside, clutching a scrap of wood that curves inwards, water ripples inside.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} step forwards and rest it down before you, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} eyes abruptly narrow, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} tail flicks in annoyance.]
Oh you think you're funny, don't you?
